trans-unit.source: Defines the metadata attribute that enables an embedded resource in an assembly.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute> class is valid only when used on assembly declarations.
It is used to enable a specified embedded resource in an assembly for use as a Web resource.
For more information on resources, see [ASP.NET Web Page Resources Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0936b3b2-9e6e-4abe-9c06-364efef9dbbd).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute"></xref> class with the specified Web resource and resource content type.
The name of the of Web resource.
The type of resource, such as "image/gif" or "text/javascript".
webResource is `null` or an empty string ("").
\- or -
contentType is `null` or an empty string ("").
Gets or set the path of a Content Delivery Network (CDN) that contains Web resources.
The path of a Content Delivery Network (CDN).

Gets or set a value that indicates to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManager"></xref> whether a script resource should be accessed using a secure connection to the content delivery network (CDN) path when the page is accessed using HTTPS.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute.CdnSupportsSecureConnection%2A> property to check whether the associated script resource should be accessed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> using a secure connection (using SSL) to a CDN.

By using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute.CdnSupportsSecureConnection%2A> property, you can avoid a warning message from the browser when your Web application attempts to request secure content from a CDN that supports SSL.
`true` if the CDN should be accessed using HTTPS; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a string containing the MIME type of the resource that is referenced by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute"></xref> class.
Examples of content types are `"image/jpeg"` and `"text/xml"`.
For more information on MIME types, go to the [Internet Assigned Numbers Authority](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=43988) Web site and refer to the section on media types.
The content type of the resource.
Gets or sets an expression that is used when a Web resource has successfully loaded.
An expression that is used when a Web resource has successfully loaded.

Gets or sets a Boolean value that determines whether, during processing of the embedded resource referenced by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute"></xref> class, other Web resource URLs are parsed and replaced with the full path to the resource.

When a resource is streamed from the assembly to the response, references to other Web resources in the embedded resources can be resolved at this time, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute.PerformSubstitution%2A> property is set to `true`.
`true` if embedded resources are resolved during processing of the resource; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets a string containing the name of the resource that is referenced by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute"></xref> class.
The name of the resource.
